trans-unit.source: Restore a virtual machines from backup | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Restore a virtual machines from backup | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to restore an Azure virtual machine from a recovery point
trans-unit.target: Learn how to restore an Azure virtual machine from a recovery point

trans-unit.source: Restore virtual machines in Azure
trans-unit.target: Restore virtual machines in Azure

trans-unit.source: Restore a virtual machine to a new VM from the backups stored in an Azure backup vault with the following steps.
trans-unit.target: Restore a virtual machine to a new VM from the backups stored in an Azure backup vault with the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Restore workflow
trans-unit.target: Restore workflow

trans-unit.source: 1. Choose an item to restore
trans-unit.target: 1. Choose an item to restore

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the **Protected Items** tab and select the virtual machine you want to restore to a new VM.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the **Protected Items** tab and select the virtual machine you want to restore to a new VM.

trans-unit.source: Protected items
trans-unit.target: Protected items

trans-unit.source: The **Recovery Point** column in the **Protected Items** page will tell you the number of recovery points for a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The **Recovery Point** column in the **Protected Items** page will tell you the number of recovery points for a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The **Newest Recovery Point** column tells you the time of the most recent backup from which a virtual machine can be restored.
trans-unit.target: The **Newest Recovery Point** column tells you the time of the most recent backup from which a virtual machine can be restored.

trans-unit.source: Click **Restore** to open the **Restore an Item** wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click **Restore** to open the **Restore an Item** wizard.

trans-unit.source: Restore an item
trans-unit.target: Restore an item

trans-unit.source: 2. Pick a recovery point
trans-unit.target: 2. Pick a recovery point

trans-unit.source: In the **select a recovery point** screen, you can restore from the newest recovery point, or from a previous point in time.
trans-unit.target: In the **select a recovery point** screen, you can restore from the newest recovery point, or from a previous point in time.

trans-unit.source: The default option selected when wizard opens is *Newest Recovery Point*
trans-unit.target: The default option selected when wizard opens is *Newest Recovery Point*

trans-unit.source: Select a recovery point
trans-unit.target: Select a recovery point

trans-unit.source: To pick an earlier point in time, choose the **Select Date** option in the dropdown and select a date in the calendar control by clicking on the **calendar icon**.
trans-unit.target: To pick an earlier point in time, choose the **Select Date** option in the dropdown and select a date in the calendar control by clicking on the **calendar icon**.

trans-unit.source: In the control, all dates that have recovery points are filled with a light gray shade and are selectable by the user.
trans-unit.target: In the control, all dates that have recovery points are filled with a light gray shade and are selectable by the user.

trans-unit.source: Select a date
trans-unit.target: Select a date

trans-unit.source: Once you click a date in the calendar control, the recovery points available on that date will be shown in recovery points table below.
trans-unit.target: Once you click a date in the calendar control, the recovery points available on that date will be shown in recovery points table below.

trans-unit.source: The **Time** column indicates the time at which the snapshot was taken.
trans-unit.target: The **Time** column indicates the time at which the snapshot was taken.

trans-unit.source: The **Type** column displays the [consistency](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/backup-azure-vms/#consistency-of-recovery-points) of the recovery point.
trans-unit.target: The **Type** column displays the [consistency](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/backup-azure-vms/#consistency-of-recovery-points) of the recovery point.

trans-unit.source: The table header shows the number of recovery points available on that day in parenthesis.
trans-unit.target: The table header shows the number of recovery points available on that day in parenthesis.

trans-unit.source: Recovery points
trans-unit.target: Recovery points

trans-unit.source: Select the recovery point from the **Recovery Points** table and click the Next arrow to go to the next screen.
trans-unit.target: Select the recovery point from the **Recovery Points** table and click the Next arrow to go to the next screen.

trans-unit.source: 3. Specify a destination location
trans-unit.target: 3. Specify a destination location

trans-unit.source: In the **Select restore instance** screen specify details of where to restore the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In the **Select restore instance** screen specify details of where to restore the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Specify the virtual machine name: In a given cloud service, the virtual machine name should be unique.
trans-unit.target: Specify the virtual machine name: In a given cloud service, the virtual machine name should be unique.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to replace an existing VM with the same name, first delete the existing VM and data disks and then restore the data from Azure Backup.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to replace an existing VM with the same name, first delete the existing VM and data disks and then restore the data from Azure Backup.

trans-unit.source: Select a cloud service for the VM: This is mandatory for creating a VM.
trans-unit.target: Select a cloud service for the VM: This is mandatory for creating a VM.

trans-unit.source: You can choose to either use an existing cloud service or create a new cloud service.
trans-unit.target: You can choose to either use an existing cloud service or create a new cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Select a storage account for the VM: This is mandatory for creating the VM.
trans-unit.target: Select a storage account for the VM: This is mandatory for creating the VM.

trans-unit.source: You can select from existing storage accounts in the same region as the Azure Backup vault.
trans-unit.target: You can select from existing storage accounts in the same region as the Azure Backup vault.

trans-unit.source: We don’t support storage accounts that are Zone redundant or of Premium storage type.
trans-unit.target: We don’t support storage accounts that are Zone redundant or of Premium storage type.

trans-unit.source: If there are no storage accounts with supported configuration, please create a storage account of supported configuration prior to starting restore operation.
trans-unit.target: If there are no storage accounts with supported configuration, please create a storage account of supported configuration prior to starting restore operation.

trans-unit.source: Select a virtual network
trans-unit.target: Select a virtual network

trans-unit.source: Select a Virtual Network: The virtual network (VNET) for the virtual machine should be selected at the time of creating the VM.
trans-unit.target: Select a Virtual Network: The virtual network (VNET) for the virtual machine should be selected at the time of creating the VM.

trans-unit.source: The restore UI shows all the VNETs within this subscription that can be used.
trans-unit.target: The restore UI shows all the VNETs within this subscription that can be used.

trans-unit.source: It is not mandatory to select a VNET for the restored VM – you will be able to connect to the restored virtual machine over the internet even if the VNET is not applied.
trans-unit.target: It is not mandatory to select a VNET for the restored VM – you will be able to connect to the restored virtual machine over the internet even if the VNET is not applied.

trans-unit.source: If the cloud service selected is associated with a virtual network, then you cannot change the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: If the cloud service selected is associated with a virtual network, then you cannot change the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Select a virtual network
trans-unit.target: Select a virtual network

trans-unit.source: Select a subnet: In case the VNET has subnets, by default the first subnet will be selected.
trans-unit.target: Select a subnet: In case the VNET has subnets, by default the first subnet will be selected.

trans-unit.source: Choose the subnet of your choice from the dropdown options.
trans-unit.target: Choose the subnet of your choice from the dropdown options.

trans-unit.source: For subnet details, go to Networks extension in the [portal home page](https://manage.windowsazure.com/), go to **Virtual Networks** and select the virtual network and drill down into Configure to see subnet details.
trans-unit.target: For subnet details, go to Networks extension in the [portal home page](https://manage.windowsazure.com/), go to **Virtual Networks** and select the virtual network and drill down into Configure to see subnet details.

trans-unit.source: Select a subnet
trans-unit.target: Select a subnet

trans-unit.source: Click the **Submit** icon in the wizard to submit the details and create a restore job.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Submit** icon in the wizard to submit the details and create a restore job.

trans-unit.source: Track the Restore operation
trans-unit.target: Track the Restore operation

trans-unit.source: Once you have input all the information into the restore wizard and submitted it Azure Backup will try to create a job to track the restore operation.
trans-unit.target: Once you have input all the information into the restore wizard and submitted it Azure Backup will try to create a job to track the restore operation.

trans-unit.source: Creating a restore job
trans-unit.target: Creating a restore job

trans-unit.source: If the job creation is successful, you will see a toast notification indicating that the job is created.
trans-unit.target: If the job creation is successful, you will see a toast notification indicating that the job is created.

trans-unit.source: You can get more details by clicking the **View Job** button that will take you to **Jobs** tab.
trans-unit.target: You can get more details by clicking the **View Job** button that will take you to **Jobs** tab.

trans-unit.source: Restore job created
trans-unit.target: Restore job created

trans-unit.source: Once the restore operation is finished, it will be marked as completed in **Jobs** tab.
trans-unit.target: Once the restore operation is finished, it will be marked as completed in **Jobs** tab.

trans-unit.source: Restore job complete
trans-unit.target: Restore job complete

trans-unit.source: After restoring the virtual machine you may need to re-install the extensions existing on the original VM and [modify the endpoints](virtual-machines-set-up-endpoints) for the virtual machine in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: After restoring the virtual machine you may need to re-install the extensions existing on the original VM and [modify the endpoints](virtual-machines-set-up-endpoints) for the virtual machine in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Restoring Domain Controller VMs
trans-unit.target: Restoring Domain Controller VMs

trans-unit.source: Backup of Domain Controller (DC) virtual machines is a supported scenario with Azure Backup.
trans-unit.target: Backup of Domain Controller (DC) virtual machines is a supported scenario with Azure Backup.

trans-unit.source: However some care must be taken during the restore process.
trans-unit.target: However some care must be taken during the restore process.

trans-unit.source: The restore experience is vastly different for Domain Controller VMs in a single-DC configuration vs. VMs in a multi-DC configuration.
trans-unit.target: The restore experience is vastly different for Domain Controller VMs in a single-DC configuration vs. VMs in a multi-DC configuration.

trans-unit.source: Single DC
trans-unit.target: Single DC

trans-unit.source: The VM can be restored (like any other VM) from the Azure portal or using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: The VM can be restored (like any other VM) from the Azure portal or using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Multiple DCs
trans-unit.target: Multiple DCs

trans-unit.source: When you have a multi-DC environment, the Domain Controllers have their own way of keeping data in sync.
trans-unit.target: When you have a multi-DC environment, the Domain Controllers have their own way of keeping data in sync.

trans-unit.source: When an older backup point is restored *without the proper precautions*, The USN rollback process can wreak havoc in a multi-DC environment.
trans-unit.target: When an older backup point is restored *without the proper precautions*, The USN rollback process can wreak havoc in a multi-DC environment.

trans-unit.source: The right way to recover such a VM is to boot it in DSRM mode.
trans-unit.target: The right way to recover such a VM is to boot it in DSRM mode.

trans-unit.source: The challenge arises because DSRM mode is not present in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The challenge arises because DSRM mode is not present in Azure.

trans-unit.source: So to restore such a VM, you cannot use the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: So to restore such a VM, you cannot use the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The only supported restore mechanism is disk-based restore using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: The only supported restore mechanism is disk-based restore using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For Domain Controller VMs in a multi-DC environment, do not use the Azure portal for restore!
trans-unit.target: For Domain Controller VMs in a multi-DC environment, do not use the Azure portal for restore!

trans-unit.source: Only PowerShell based restore is supported
trans-unit.target: Only PowerShell based restore is supported

trans-unit.source: Read more about the [USN rollback problem](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dd363553) and the strategies suggested to fix it.
trans-unit.target: Read more about the [USN rollback problem](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dd363553) and the strategies suggested to fix it.

trans-unit.source: Restoring VMs with special network configurations
trans-unit.target: Restoring VMs with special network configurations

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup supports backup for following special network configurations of virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup supports backup for following special network configurations of virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: VMs under load balancer ( internal and external)
trans-unit.target: VMs under load balancer ( internal and external)

trans-unit.source: VMs with multiple reserved IPs
trans-unit.target: VMs with multiple reserved IPs

trans-unit.source: VMs with multiple NICs
trans-unit.target: VMs with multiple NICs

trans-unit.source: These configurations mandate following considerations while restoring them.
trans-unit.target: These configurations mandate following considerations while restoring them.

trans-unit.source: Please use PowerShell based restore flow to recreate the special network configuration of VMs post restore.
trans-unit.target: Please use PowerShell based restore flow to recreate the special network configuration of VMs post restore.

trans-unit.source: Restoring from the UI:
trans-unit.target: Restoring from the UI:

trans-unit.source: While restoring from UI, **always choose a new cloud service**.
trans-unit.target: While restoring from UI, **always choose a new cloud service**.

trans-unit.source: Please note that since portal only takes mandatory parameters during restore flow, VMs restored using UI will lose the special network configuration they possess.
trans-unit.target: Please note that since portal only takes mandatory parameters during restore flow, VMs restored using UI will lose the special network configuration they possess.

trans-unit.source: In other words, restore VMs will be normal VMs without configuration of load balancer or multi NIC or multiple reserved IP.
trans-unit.target: In other words, restore VMs will be normal VMs without configuration of load balancer or multi NIC or multiple reserved IP.

trans-unit.source: Restoring from PowerShell:
trans-unit.target: Restoring from PowerShell:

trans-unit.source: PowerShell has the ability to just restore the VM disks from backup and not create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: PowerShell has the ability to just restore the VM disks from backup and not create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This is helpful when restoring virtual machines which require special network configurations mentined above.
trans-unit.target: This is helpful when restoring virtual machines which require special network configurations mentined above.

trans-unit.source: In order to fully recreate the virtual machine post restoring disks, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: In order to fully recreate the virtual machine post restoring disks, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Restore the disks from backup vault using [Azure Backup PowerShell](../backup-azure-vms-automation.md#restore-an-azure-vm)
trans-unit.target: Restore the disks from backup vault using [Azure Backup PowerShell](../backup-azure-vms-automation.md#restore-an-azure-vm)

trans-unit.source: Create the VM config required for load balancer/multiple NIC/multiple reserved IP using the PowerShell cmdlets and use it to create the VM of desired configuration.
trans-unit.target: Create the VM config required for load balancer/multiple NIC/multiple reserved IP using the PowerShell cmdlets and use it to create the VM of desired configuration.

trans-unit.source: Create VM in cloud service with [Internal Load balancer ](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/load-balancer-internal-getstarted/)
trans-unit.target: Create VM in cloud service with [Internal Load balancer ](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/load-balancer-internal-getstarted/)

trans-unit.source: Create VM to connect to [Internet facing load balancer] (https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/load-balancer-internet-getstarted/)
trans-unit.target: Create VM to connect to [Internet facing load balancer] (https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/load-balancer-internet-getstarted/)

trans-unit.source: Create VM with [multiple NICs](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-networks-multiple-nics/)
trans-unit.target: Create VM with [multiple NICs](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-networks-multiple-nics/)

trans-unit.source: Create VM with [multiple reserved IPs](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-networks-reserved-public-ip/)
trans-unit.target: Create VM with [multiple reserved IPs](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-networks-reserved-public-ip/)

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting errors
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting errors

trans-unit.source: Manage virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Manage virtual machines
